name: Change Healthcare Ransomware Attack
summary: ALPHV/BlackCat affiliate compromised Change Healthcare, a subsidiary of UnitedHealth Group that processes ~15 billion healthcare transactions annually. The attack disrupted healthcare payment processing nationwide, affecting pharmacies, hospitals, and healthcare providers across the United States. Considered one of the most impactful healthcare cyberattacks in US history.

attack_phases.name: Initial Access via Citrix
attack_phases.description: Attackers gained access through a Citrix remote access portal using compromised credentials. The account reportedly lacked multi-factor authentication.
indicators: Citrix portal access from unusual location

attack_phases.name: Lateral Movement and Persistence
attack_phases.description: Nine-day dwell time during which attackers moved laterally through the network, harvested credentials, and established persistence.

attack_phases.name: Data Exfiltration
attack_phases.description: Attackers exfiltrated approximately 6 TB of data containing protected health information (PHI) for millions of Americans.

attack_phases.name: Ransomware Deployment
attack_phases.description: ALPHV/BlackCat ransomware deployed across Change Healthcare systems, encrypting critical healthcare processing infrastructure.

operational_impact.healthcare_providers: Hospitals unable to verify insurance, process claims

financial_impact.provider_impact: Billions in delayed payments to healthcare providers

notable_events.event: ALPHV conducts exit scam, claims law enforcement seizure

alphv_exit_scam.description: After receiving ransom payment, ALPHV operators conducted an exit scam, posting fake FBI seizure notice and absconding with affiliate's share
alphv_exit_scam.affiliate_response: Affiliate reportedly still had data, threatened further leaks through RansomHub

lessons_learned: MFA is critical for remote access portals
Healthcare supply chain creates systemic risk
Single points of failure in healthcare infrastructure
Ransom payment doesn't guarantee data security
